sentences.sentence: Soon he found it.
There was indeed something gold lying on the white snow.
He rushed toward it, bent down( 弯腰 ) and touched it.
It was a piece of golden fabric( 布料 ) that was covered with stars, and it felt like there was something inside it.
He called out to his friend and told him that he had found the treasure that had fallen from the sky.
When his friend arrived, they sat down together in the snow, and opened the fabric( 布料 ) to see what was inside.
They were sure it had to be gold.
But they were disappointed( 失望的 ), because there was no gold to be seen, and no silver either.
In fact, there was no treasure of any kind, only a little child who was asleep.
One of the men said to the other, “This is not what we hoped for, and very bad luck for us too, because what good can a child do for a man?
Let us leave it here, and go on our way.
We are only poor men, and have children of our own, and cannot afford to( 负担起... ) feed another.”
But his friend answered him: “No, it would be wrong to just leave the child to die here in the snow.
Even though I am as poor as you are, and have many mouths to feed, and little to feed them with, still I will bring it home with me.
My wife will take care of( 照顾 ) it.”
So he picked up( 捡起 ) the child very gently, held it in his coat to protect it from the cold, and went back to the village.
His friend thought that he was a soft-hearted fool( 傻瓜 ) for keeping the child.
And when they came to the village, his friend said to him, “You have the child, so give me the golden fabric( 布料 ), because it is right that we should share.”
But he answered him: “No, because it is not mine, and not yours either, but belongs( 属于 ) to the child.”
After saying this, he said goodbye, went to his own house and knocked on the door.
When his wife opened the door, and saw that her husband had returned safe to her, she put her arms around his neck and kissed him.
Then she took the wood he was carrying on his back, brushed the snow off his boots( 靴子 ), and told him to come inside.
But he said to her, “I have found something in the forest, and I have brought it to you to take care of( 照顾 ).”
And he did not move from the doorway( 门口 ).
“What is it?” she cried.
“Show it to me, because there are many things we need around the house.” He opened his coat, and showed her the sleeping child.
“A child!” she said.
“We have children of our own, and still you bring someone else’s baby into our home?
Who knows whether it will bring us bad luck? And how can we care for it?”
She was very angry with him.
“It is not someone else’s baby, it is a Star-Child,” he answered.
Then he told her the strange way in which he had found it.
But this did not calm( 平复 ) her, and she spoke angrily: “Our children do not have enough bread, and yet we will feed the child of another?
Who will care for us? And who will give us food?”
“God will care for us.
He even takes care of( 照顾 ) the birds, and feeds them,” he answered.
“Do the birds not die of hunger in the winter?” she asked. “And is it not winter now?”
Her husband did not answer, and did not move from the doorway( 门口 ).
A bitterly( 非常 ) cold wind came from the forest and went through the open door.
The Woodcutter( 伐木工 )’s wife began to feel very cold, and she said to her husband:
“Will you please close the door? The wind is coming into the house, and I am cold.”
“Doesn’t a bitter( 寒冷的 ) wind always come into a house where there is someone with a cold heart?” he asked.
The woman did not answer, but moved closer to the fire.
After a while the woman turned around and looked at her husband.
Her eyes were full of tears( 眼泪 ).
The Woodcutter( 伐木工 ) came inside quickly, placed the child in her arms, and she kissed it.
Then she laid it in a little bed where the youngest of their own children was lying.

question.cn: 当他们打开那块布的时候发现了什么？
question.en: What did they find when they opened the fabric?

options.en: They found a lot of silver.
They found a lot of gold.

analysis: 文中提到“But they were disappointed, because there was no gold to be seen, and no silver either. In fact, there was no treasure of any kind, only a little child who was asleep.”因此本题选B。
